p: One gram of each powdered sample was separately added into 20 ml of distilled water in test tubes. Then, the mixtures were boiled in a water bath for 7 min and were filtered while hot using the filter paper into Erlenmeyer flasks. After cooling, 1 ml of the filtrate was diluted to 5 ml solution using distilled water, and then a few drops (2-3) of 10% ferric chloride were added to it. Formation of bluish-black or brownish-green precipitate indicated the presence of tannins [ 30].
